"People are giving us shit because we don't currently have amateurs on our team. I'd like people to think for a quick second before getting their pitchforks out. This is a qualifier to GET IN the NACS meaning there's risk involved using unproven talent to get into the damn league in the first place. Only a moron would use 5 random players to try and get into NACS. Now that we've qualified for NACS, what does that mean? That means we can now try out players and see who is good because we aren't at risking of not being in the damn thing, but we need to keep in mind we need to be good enough to; stay in the NACS in the first place and to be able to win it/qualify for the LCS, since training players COSTS money+time from our end. We have an entire sub challenger team that we've been scrimming and even given an analyst and show them how to use data/teach them pick and bans."
Wow maybe you should read.

From OP's perspective as a former Riot Esports Branch but although I do think this article was a bit biased especially about Monte's bit because he is close friend with Monte.
tl;dr: Riot wants to franchise LCS in the future so they want good LCS Team Owners so they have to weed out the bad and thinks that Badawi is shady and thinks that Riot's ruling was fair based on previous ruling and evidences. He stated that if Riot were to release the evidences, people would roast Badawi and side with Riot. \
He thinks that Monte was mislead and that accusations against him was injust without any evidences so he suggest Monte should take it to court so Riot will have to reveal the evidences for the "millions in damages".

WRITING.TITLE: My RTT Ping spike to 300-500 only in Quickplay and Brawl! Smooth in Coop AI and Training.
WRITING.TEXT:
As my title suggest, my RTT ping which is my connection ping communication to the game's server spike up to 300-500 makes the game unplayable FPS drops.
Remember, this only happens in Quickplay and Brawl where it is 6 players on each team.
I can play smoothly on Players vs AI and Training with no lag no matter what the settings is!
I have been having this issue since Closed Beta weekend tests and have tried all the upgrading to my Nvidia drivers, etc. No issues were solved.
I already posted it in the Overwatch tech support but also posting here incase somebody has a solution!
http://us.battle.net/forums/en/overwatch/topic/20743764377#1
There is also Grudge vs The Ring..

I think I'm still getting lag but not as bad as this when I posted it.
My RTT Ping is not showing more on my screen to see what it is :/
Yes, it was stated in his ban ruling by Riot.
